title: Network Types
dialog: Welcome to a new level where we delve into the intriguing world of network types! In this level, we'll dive into three main network types: LAN, MAN, and WAN

title: Network Types
dialog: These types are like different paths for data to travel, and knowing their distinctions will help you move around the online world with more confidence

title: Local Area Network (LAN)
dialog: It's a network confined to a limited geographical area, like a home, office building, or school campus.

title: Local Area Network (LAN)
dialog: LANs excel at high-speed communication within this confined space, enabling devices to share resources like printers, files, and games seamlessly.

title: Metropolitan Area Network (MAN)
dialog: Zoom out a little, and you'll encounter the MAN, a network that stretches across a city or a large campus. Picture this as the broader urban area connecting various LANs.

title: Metropolitan Area Network (MAN)
dialog: MANs provide faster data rates compared to WANs and are ideal for institutions with multiple campuses that need to communicate swiftly and efficiently.

title: Wide Area Network (WAN)
dialog: Take your imagination to a global scale, and you're in the territory of WANs. These networks cover vast distances, linking LANs and MANs across cities, countries, and continents.

title: Wide Area Network (WAN)
dialog: WANs are the backbone of global communication, connecting people and businesses worldwide.

title: Wide Area Network (WAN)
dialog: Whether you're video conferencing with colleagues on another continent or browsing a website hosted far away, WANs make it possible.

title: Now you are ready for the next challenge!
dialog: You've now unveiled the distinctive landscapes of LAN, MAN, and WAN. As you journey through this level, you'll encounter scenarios where you'll need to match

title: Now you are ready for the next challenge!
dialog: the right network type to different situations. This understanding will not only deepen your grasp of networking but also empower you to make informed choices in a digitally connected world.
